page.title: 10NATIONAL PARKS IN BRITAIN
page.content: The{National Parks}and{Access to the {Countryside Act}became law in{December {1949,}following a campaign for National Parks, which had began in the first quarter of the{Twentieth {Century. The campaign was made by anxious people who wanted to protect the countryside. The{Yorkshire Dales}was the seventh of the ten National Parks to be designed. The amount of land is{680 square miles including{Dentdale,Garsdale}and the {Southern Howsgill Fells,Swaledale, {Wensleydale,Upper Wharfedale,Upper {Ribblesdale,Malhamdale}and the{Valley {of Greta}in the{Ingleborough}area.
